net.sf.freecol.client.control

Class ConnectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.freecol.client.control.FreeColClientHolder
      • net.sf.freecol.client.control.ConnectController

  • public final class ConnectController
extends FreeColClientHolder
    The controller responsible for starting a server and connecting to it. PreGameInputHandler will be set as the input handler when a successful login has been completed,

      • ConnectController

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String host,
                     int port)
        Starts the client and connects to host:port. Public for the test suite.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to use.
        host - The name of the machine running the FreeColServer.
        port - The port to use when connecting to the host.
        Returns:
        True if the login succeeds.

      • startMultiplayerGame

        public boolean startMultiplayerGame(Specification specification,
                                    boolean publicServer,
                                    int port)
        Starts a multiplayer server and connects to it.
        Parameters:
        specification - The Specification for the game.
        publicServer - Whether to make the server public.
        port - The port in which the server should listen for new clients.
        Returns:
        True if the game is started successfully.

      • joinMultiplayerGame

        public boolean joinMultiplayerGame(java.lang.String host,
                                   int port)
        Join an existing multiplayer game.
        Parameters:
        host - The name of the machine running the server.
        port - The port to use when connecting to the host.
        Returns:
        True if the game starts successfully.

      • startSinglePlayerGame

        public boolean startSinglePlayerGame(Specification spec,
                                     boolean skip)
        Starts a new single player game by connecting to the server. FIXME: connect client/server directly (not using network-classes)
        Parameters:
        spec - The Specification for the game.
        skip - Skip the start game panel.
        Returns:
        True if the game starts successfully.

      • startSavedGame

        public boolean startSavedGame(java.io.File file,
                              java.lang.String userMsg)
        Loads and starts a game from the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - The saved game.
        userMsg - An optional message key to be displayed early.
        Returns:
        True if the game starts successully.

      • reconnect

        public boolean reconnect()
        Reconnects to the server.
        Returns:
        True if the reconnection succeeds.

      • logout

        public void logout(boolean notifyServer)
        Sends a logout message to the server.
        Parameters:
        notifyServer - Whether or not the server should be notified of the logout. For example: if the server kicked us out then we don't need to confirm with a logout message.

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame(boolean stopServer,
                     boolean notifyServer)
        Quits the current game, optionally notifying and stopping the server.
        Parameters:
        stopServer - Whether to stop the server.
        notifyServer - Whether or not the server should be notified of the logout. For example: if the server kicked us out then we don't need to confirm with a logout message.

      • quitGame

        public void quitGame(boolean stopServer)
        Quits the current game. If a server is running it will be stopped if stopServer is true. The server and perhaps the clients (if a server is running through this client and stopServer is true) will be notified.
        Parameters:
        stopServer - Indicates whether or not a server that was started through this client should be stopped.

      • getServerList

        public java.util.List<ServerInfo> getServerList()
        Gets a list of servers from the meta server.
        Returns:
        A list of ServerInfo objects, or null on error.
